<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file defines the AbstractCallSite class, which is a is a wrapper that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// allows treating direct, indirect, and callback calls the same.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;IR&#95;ABSTRACTCALLSITE&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;IR&#95;ABSTRACTCALLSITE&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">llvm/IR/Constants.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/function-h">llvm/IR/Function.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h">llvm/IR/InstrTypes.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/value-h">llvm/IR/Value.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &lt;cassert&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/argument">Argument</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// AbstractCallSite</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An abstract call site is a wrapper that allows to treat direct,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// indirect, and callback calls the same. If an abstract call site</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// represents a direct or indirect call site it behaves like a stripped</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// down version of a normal call site object. The abstract call site can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// also represent a callback call, thus the fact that the initially</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// called function (=broker) may invoke a third one (=callback callee).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In this case, the abstract call site hides the middle man, hence the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// broker function. The result is a representation of the callback call,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// inside the broker, but in the context of the original call to the broker.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// There are up to three functions involved when we talk about callback call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// sites. The caller (1), which invokes the broker function. The broker</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function (2), that will invoke the callee zero or more times. And finally</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the callee (3), which is the target of the callback call.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The abstract call site will handle the mapping from parameters to arguments</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// depending on the semantic of the broker function. However, it is important</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to note that the mapping is often partial. Thus, some arguments of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// call/invoke instruction are mapped to parameters of the callee while others</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are not.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a582d0050c740c1f23bce6bc0c8c5b189">AbstractCallSite</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The encoding of a callback with regards to the underlying instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractcallsite/callbackinfo"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractcallsite/callbackinfo">CallbackInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// For direct/indirect calls the parameter encoding is empty. If it is not,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// the abstract call site represents a callback. In that case, the first</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// element of the encoding vector represents which argument of the call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// site CB is the callback callee. The remaining elements map parameters</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// (identified by their position) to the arguments that will be passed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// through (also identified by position but in the call site instruction).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// NOTE that we use LLVM argument numbers (starting at 0) and not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// clang/source argument numbers (starting at 1). The -1 entries represent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// unknown values that are passed to the callee.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractcallsite/callbackinfo/#a8ca1c3789a06bd03293acd7799c82778"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractcallsite/callbackinfo/#a8ca1c3789a06bd03293acd7799c82778">ParameterEncodingTy</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;int, 0&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractcallsite/callbackinfo/#af8fe46b9cdbd737fe10dda57651d6027"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractcallsite/callbackinfo/#a8ca1c3789a06bd03293acd7799c82778">ParameterEncodingTy</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractcallsite/callbackinfo/#af8fe46b9cdbd737fe10dda57651d6027">ParameterEncoding</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">private</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The underlying call site:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   caller -&gt; callee,             if this is a direct or indirect call site</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   caller -&gt; broker function,    if this is a callback call site</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42;CB;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The encoding of a callback with regards to the underlying instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractcallsite/callbackinfo">CallbackInfo</a> CI;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Sole constructor for abstract call sites (ACS).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// An abstract call site can only be constructed through a llvm::Use because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// each operand (=use) of an instruction could potentially be a different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// abstract call site. Furthermore, even if the value of the llvm::Use is the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// same, and the user is as well, the abstract call sites might not be.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If a use is not associated with an abstract call site the constructed ACS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// will evaluate to false if converted to a boolean.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If the use is the callee use of a call or invoke instruction, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// constructed abstract call site will behave as a llvm::CallSite would.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If the use is not a callee use of a call or invoke instruction, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// callback metadata is used to determine the argument &lt;-&gt; parameter mapping</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// as well as the callee of the abstract call site.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a582d0050c740c1f23bce6bc0c8c5b189">AbstractCallSite</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &#42;U);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Add operand uses of \\p CB that represent callback uses into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p CallbackUses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// All uses added to \\p CallbackUses can be used to create abstract call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sites for which AbstractCallSite::isCallbackCall() will return true.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a401e244b78386047c64edc64f80ba9c0">getCallbackUses</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &amp;CB,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const Use &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;CallbackUses);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Conversion operator to conveniently check for a valid/initialized ACS.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a849dee873893038338c06b0829b41ca4"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">explicit</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">operator</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> bool()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CB != </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return the underlying instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a1d97fd714e72a72bd6d96a8b1ebf62ea"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a1d97fd714e72a72bd6d96a8b1ebf62ea">getInstruction</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CB; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if this ACS represents a direct call.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a27b382e987878c9f338d79220acc06b2"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a27b382e987878c9f338d79220acc06b2">isDirectCall</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if this ACS represents an indirect call.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a31b793fd30a35a9db6bbd8ead7796ba0"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a31b793fd30a35a9db6bbd8ead7796ba0">isIndirectCall</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if this ACS represents a callback call.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a2300cb53451591b87c7c5621c31643a2"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a2300cb53451591b87c7c5621c31643a2">isCallbackCall</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For a callback call site the callee is ALWAYS stored first in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transitive values vector. Thus, a non-empty vector indicates a callback.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> !CI.ParameterEncoding.empty();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if @p UI is the use that defines the callee of this ACS.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the use is actually in a constant cast expression which itself</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// has only one use, we look through the constant cast expression.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;CE = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantExpr&gt;</a>(U-&gt;getUser()))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (CE-&gt;hasOneUse() &amp;&amp; CE-&gt;isCast())</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight">)CB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#ad2be14a6cee99d5f27223178c42366f3">getArgOperandNo</a>(U) == CI.ParameterEncoding&#91;0&#93;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Apply function Func to each CB&#39;s callback call site.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> UnaryFunction&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2fbc912ee1cbb5ddcaea71940aa33685"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2fbc912ee1cbb5ddcaea71940aa33685">forEachCallbackCallSite</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &amp;CB, UnaryFunction Func) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;const Use &#42;, 4u&gt;</a> CallbackUses;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a401e244b78386047c64edc64f80ba9c0">AbstractCallSite::getCallbackUses</a>(CB, CallbackUses);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &#42;U : CallbackUses) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite">AbstractCallSite</a> ACS(U);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(ACS &amp;&amp; ACS.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite/#a2300cb53451591b87c7c5621c31643a2">isCallbackCall</a>() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;must be a callback call&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Func(ACS);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Apply function Func to each CB&#39;s callback function.</span></CodeLine>
